page.title: 09BICKLEY COPPICE SCOUT CAMP
page.content:
After many years of fund raising, and searching for a suitable site, the local Scout & Guide Ass'n have bought the site at Bickley Coppice at a cost of Â£35,000. The site comprises 47 acres of light forest with clearings and it borders the River Severn at one point. We are now raising money to provide mains services, while week-end working parties of scouts and guides are pressing ahead with the development of the site on a self-help basis.
The young people who have taken part in this project have given, and gained, a great deal. When complete it should prove an ideal centre for the enjoyment of the great outdoors in the true scouting tradition, both for local youngsters, and those from further afield.
